docs.lead_paragraph: By the returs ofthe Health officer for the week ending Saturday last, it appears there were 197 dcanbs in the cuy of Brooklyn--95 males, 102 females, adults 78, children 119.

docs.lead_paragraph: Died at Nice, in Saromia, on the 28th of July, in the 67th year of her age, MARY SABILLA, the wife of VINCENT NOVELLO, the celebrated musical composer. She was an accomplished woman, a loving wife, an unfailing friend, and a devoted mother.
docs.snippet: Died at Nice, in Saromia, on the 28th of July, in the 67th year of her age, MARY SABILLA, the wife of VINCENT NOVELLO, the celebrated musical composer. She was an accomplished woman, a loving wife, an unfailing friend, and a devoted mother.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; MME. GRISI'S FAREWELL TO ENGLAND. ALL QUIET IN SPAIN. ILL-TREATMENT OF A SEAMAN. Two Highly Interesting Abduction Cases. Cotton Unchanged--Brendstufl's Improved--Consuls $2 3-4?? 7-S.. Reappointment of Concha, Captain General of Cuba. REMARKABLE ?BIALS IN BRITAIN. Austria in the Way of England and France ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIO. MOVEMENT OF THE POWERS THE RUSSIANS RETIRED FROM BUCHAREST, Invasion of Crimea by the English and French.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Ballic, from Liverpool on Wednesday, Aug. 9, arrived at this port on Saturday at about 4 P.M., brining four days' later news from Europe. The Asia arrived out on Sunday morning, the 6th, at 8 1/2 o'clock.
docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamer Ballic, from Liverpool on Wednesday, Aug. 9, arrived at this port on Saturday at about 4 P.M., brining four days' later news from Europe. The Asia arrived out on Sunday morning, the 6th, at 8 1/2 o'clock.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY,; Explosion in a Printing Office. Street Prenching. THE CHOLERA. City Morality.

docs.lead_paragraph: BATTLE OF BENNINGTON.--The anniversary of this battle was celebrated on the ground, Aug. 16. The orator of the day was J. T. HEADLEY, Esq., a name intimately, and that justly identified with the Revolutionary history of this country.
docs.snippet: BATTLE OF BENNINGTON.--The anniversary of this battle was celebrated on the ground, Aug. 16. The orator of the day was J. T. HEADLEY, Esq., a name intimately, and that justly identified with the Revolutionary history of this country.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. EDITOR: I am happy to inform you that your account of our sad accident here is exaggerated. But one life is lost. Five others have been more or less injured; some of them seriously, none it is hoped fatally or even permanently. Mr. BOHALL was instantly killed. The bones of his arms and chests were broken in fragments, and his face considerably ma?. His young and

headline.main: Arrival of a Murderer from Port-au-Prince Logwood Market, $c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bark Aaron J. Hartry arrived here to-day from Pori-an-Prince. She brings with her JOHN MILLER, who was sent home by the United States Consul, at his own request, to stand a trial for the murder of a woodcutter named MYERS, whom he killed in the woods in Washington Township, Morris County, New-Jersey, about ten months since.

docs.lead_paragraph: By letter from JOHN G. WILLIS, Esq., U. S. Consul at Loanda, S. W. Coast of Africa. to a friend in this city, we have some interesting information concerning an interior exploration of that portion of Africa, to the following effect: On the 1st of June, Dr. LIVINGSTON, of England. arrived at Loanda, all the way from the Cape of Good Hope, through the centre of Africa.

headline.main: To the Patrons of the Argus.

docs.lead_paragraph: In accordance with the arrangements heretofore announced, the undersigned retired from his connection with this paper on the 1st day of August, inst., and transferred his interest therein to GIDEON J. TUCKER, who will be associated with SHERMAN CROSWELL and JAMES I JOHNSON, (for many years copartners of the undersigned,) in the proprietorship and management of the concern.
